Subsea Project Engineer Job at Deep Water Consultancy & Engineering Services Limited (DWC & E)




        
    

        
        Deep Water Consultancy & Engineering Services Limited (DWC & E) is an Oil & Gas Consultancy Service Company specializing in subsea technologies, pipeline management, and field development. We deliver innovative solutions for managing ageing assets and executing offshore projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Subsea Project Engineer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Work Mode: On-site

Role Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking to engage a Project Engineer with subsea knowledge to support project engineering activities across subsea, pipeline, and field development projects.
	The ideal candidate will be expected to execute project planning, technical documentation, risk assessments, and field operations while developing on-the-job skills from industry experts.
	We are looking for a candidate with the ability to multitask and creatively adapt to emerging technology and engineering principles.


Job Responsibilities


	Project planning, scheduling, and execution for oil and gas projects.
	Prepare and maintain technical documentation, reports, and cost estimates.
	Supervise and support field operations, including offshore and onshore site activities
	Participate in QA/QC inspections, risk assessments, and integrity management tasks.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve technical and operational challenges.
	Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives and knowledge sharing within the team.
	Be fully familiar with the requirements of all documents that make up the contract including general conditions of contract, scope of work, Design Basis, specifications, codes and standards
	Shall ensure that the work and deliverables of trainee Engineers and formats for drawings & documents meets the requirements as per the Quality Plan.


Job Requirements


	B.Eng. in Marine Engineering, Marine Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Material & Metallurgical Engineering, Naval Architecture or a related Engineering discipline
	4–6 years of minimum experience in the engineering field with strong knowledge of the oil & gas industry
	NYSC (completed)
	Certifications and Licenses in relevant engineering areas.
	Knowledge of P&IDs, PFD, ROV use – Its functionalities and applications, field support vessel types, platform types, flowlines & risers.
	Experience with MS Office. MS Project, Primavera & AutoCAD and other relevant engineering software.
	Up-to-date knowledge of technology on Pipelines & Installations and Subsea structures.
	Working knowledge of RAM analysis, FMECA and/or Functional Safety engineering.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving, and teamwork skills
	Good Communication skills


Why Join Us?


	Gain hands-on oil & gas project experience, mentorship from industry leaders, and opportunities for professional growth.
	Exciting independent role with established support
	Fast Career growth opportunity
	Competitive remuneration.


Method of Application
Interested and qualifie candidates should send their CV to: hr@dwcengineering.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

  "description": "Genesis Group Nigeria is a wholly Nigerian owned group with business interests in hotels, restaurants, cinemas, shopping malls, real estate development, catering and snack foods. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Trans Amadi, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	The Internal Control Manager is responsible for safeguarding the company&rsquo;s assets, ensuring compliance with hospitality industry standards, and maintaining operational integrity across all departments.
	This role drives a culture of accountability by assessing risks, monitoring key control processes (cash handling, procurement, inventory, guest billing, etc.), and implementing corrective actions that enhance financial accuracy and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities
Risk Assessment &amp; Control Framework:


	Map, evaluate, and regularly update business processes (front office, F&amp;B, rooms, purchasing, payroll, spa, events) to identify potential control gaps or exposure areas.
	Develop, document, and continuously refine the internal control framework in line with hotel brand standards and local regulatory requirements.
	Conduct periodic risk-based audits focused on operational and financial areas unique to the hospitality environment.


Operational Controls &amp; Process Improvement:


	Oversee cash and credit control procedures across outlets, ensuring accurate daily reconciliation, float management, and variance resolution.
	Review procurement-to-payment cycles to verify vendor authenticity, price competitiveness, and adherence to approval matrices.
	Monitor inventory management for food, beverage, minibar, and housekeeping supplies; enforce cycle counts and loss prevention measures.
	Work closely with operational heads to streamline procedures without compromising compliance or guest experience.


Compliance &amp; Reporting:


	Ensure compliance with internal policies, brand audit requirements, and statutory regulations (tax, data protection, labor, etc.).
	Prepare clear, data-driven internal control reports and present findings with actionable recommendations to management and ownership.
	Track remediation plans and verify that all audit points are closed within agreed timelines.


Training &amp; Culture of Control:


	Conduct regular training sessions for department heads and team members on internal control principles, fraud prevention, and ethical conduct.
	Act as the control liaison between corporate office, property management, and external auditors.
	Promote accountability and control consciousness throughout the property.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration (CPA, ACCA, CIA preferred).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in internal audit, finance, or internal controls within the hospitality sector.
	Proven ability to translate audit findings into practical, property-level solutions.
	Excellent analytical skills, integrity, and diplomacy in handling sensitive operational matters.


Key Competencies:


	In-depth understanding of hotel operations and cost control mechanisms.
	High attention to detail with the ability to identify inefficiencies and propose improvements.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively across departments.
	Business-minded approach balancing control with operational practicality.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;vacancies@genesisgroupng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

	The head of marketing will be responsible for creating and executing integrated marketing strategies that elevate the brand, generate qualified leads, driving brand growth, customer acquisition, and engagement across both B2B and B2C segments&mdash;developers, landlords, brokers, tenants, and institutional investors.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities (Duties)
Marketing Strategy &amp; Leadership:


	Develop and execute comprehensive marketing plans that support the company&rsquo;s business objectives across B2B and B2C verticals.
	Define brand positioning, messaging, and value propositions in the PropTech landscape.
	Build and lead a high-performing marketing team across digital, content, growth, and communications.


Demand Generation &amp; Lead Acquisition:


	Lead digital performance marketing campaigns to drive leads for property sales, rentals, and enterprise platform clients.
	Optimize user acquisition, and conversion funnels via SEO, SEM, email, social media, and paid media.
	Design lead nurturing workflows using CRM and marketing automation (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo).

	Build and evolve the brand identity across all touchpoints&mdash;website, mobile app, social media, PR, and events.
	Oversee content strategy including blogs, case studies, videos, and newsletters.
	Develop compelling storytelling around technology, innovation, and customer success.

	Collaborate with Product and Sales teams to develop go-to-market strategies for new features, tools, or platforms.
	Craft product messaging, sales collateral, and customer onboarding content to support user adoption and retention.


PR, Events &amp; Partnerships:


	Manage public relations, media outreach, and thought leadership initiatives.
	Organize and participate in real estate conferences, PropTech summits, webinars, and community engagement events.
	Build marketing partnerships within the ecosystem including developers, property managers, and fintech partners.


Real Estate-Specific Marketing Execution:


	Oversee go-to-market strategies for new real estate launches, site promotions, open houses, and virtual tours.
	Drive targeted campaigns for real estate audiences: investors, buyers, tenants, developers, and agents.
	Work closely with the sales, leasing, and development teams to support property-level marketing and reporting.


Data, Analytics &amp; Optimization:


	Monitor KPIs, campaign performance, and marketing ROI using the right tools.
	Report marketing results to leadership and make data-driven decisions to improve outcomes.
	Implement marketing automation, and best practices.

	Strong understanding of property lifecycle, real estate brokerage models, and PropTech ecosystem.
	Experience with digital marketing tools and platforms: Google Ads, Meta Business Suite, HubSpot, CRM systems.
	Exceptional leadership, communication, storytelling, and cross-functional collaboration skills.
	Strong analytical and creative problem-solving abilities.
	Strong leadership, interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Academic Qualification (Minimum)


	Bachelor&rsquo;s or Master&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Business, Real Estate, or related field.
	5 years of marketing experience, with at least 3&ndash;5 years in a leadership role.
	Proven success in both PropTech marketing (residential or commercial).


Method of Application&nbsp;
